messages: 2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (15:41): how can I restrict a grab to e.g. the x and y axis?
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:41): press x or y
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (15:41): genjix, x and y at the same time
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:41): but you mean both?
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:41): or XX for Localaxis
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:41): :) wish I knew
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:42): shift+AxisLetter to ignore an Axis
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (15:42): so there's just the "switch to top view" option?
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (15:42): LOD, let's try that ...
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:42): ahh cool
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (15:42): ah, great
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (15:42): thanks
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:42): thanks LOD
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:42): LOD: whats that XX for localaxis mean?
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:43): add a Cube, TAB, rotate it
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:43): then Grab XX ;)
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:43): you will understand
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:43): fantastic
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:43): there is Local or Global coord
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:44): omg, this is great
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:44): + i got to eat :D
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (15:44): extra handy for rotating the camera that

0521dbbd83b8489e3fcf894e6d279f7f (15:44): when i add a bone, i hafto press g to define the length etc of it, the book says it will just follow the mouse? Also it doesn't continue to a second bone automatically. Can anyone help?
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (15:44): since local coords are usually more sane than global
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:44): best thing for selecting a row of verts thats 45 deg
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:44): placidbeans, ctrl+LMB
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:45): to convert Local to Global, ctrl+a
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (15:45): genjix: use alt-rmb
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (15:45): for selecting rows of verts
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:45): vertex loop?
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:45): but under Linux :/
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:45): whys that?
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:45): try shift+alt+RMB
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (15:45): what sux under linux?
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:45): works for me
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:45): it is a winManager combo
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (15:46): oh, yes, I changed that
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:46): Away From Keyboard
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (15:46): gnome defaults to Alt for wm operations
0521dbbd83b8489e3fcf894e6d279f7f (15:46): LOD: thanks, cntrl_lmb works, but do i need to press g to position the first bone?
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (15:46): you can just change it to super
77a274a60caad728c4c99df0c2654e3f (15:46): went my whole life modelling without knowing those super duper key combs
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (15:51): you can have a lot of fun unter osx too, where F9-F12 bring up expose by default
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (15:51): always these OS clashes!
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (15:56): in x11 you can make a program grab the input
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (15:56): in osx also I imagine, mostly used for game
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (16:04): but that's a nasty thing to do ;)
a18ed6f22697f776ac5c8f18d1732caa (16:08): morning
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:19): ok, go it, ubuntu 64 -bit does not run skype
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:20): skype is a closed system anyway
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:21): but it should be quite possible to get skype running also
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:22): casanova_: does it crash or what?
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:22): nope. it simply doesn't accept the binary
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:23): yes, debian doesn't run mixed
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:24): i've tried installing the .deb package; it only does 32 -bit kernel
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:24): you can get the static .tar.bz2
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:24): then the static and the dynamic binary; they don't run on X.org
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:25): which sucks cos X.org is generally muchbetter than Xfree
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:25): xorg is as far as applications know, identical to xfree
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:27): I guess skype just has broken packages
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:27): their repositories were broken as well
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:27): can't you just use SIP?
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:27): sip? can i connect wuth other skype users using a sip app
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:28): no, due to skype being a closed network
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:28): can you connect to vonage users using skype?
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:28): wish there was an open source skype client
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:28): or sip users using skype?
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:28): heck, even the skype protocol is propertiary
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:28): yes, you can, but you need to pay for connecting outside their network
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:29): I just wish google would implement SIP in google talk soon
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:29): even MSN is proprietary, yet it's hacked for GAIM .. =DD
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:29): That's a bit different
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:29): mmh, google talk for Linux?
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:29): you can use nearly any IM client with google talk
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:30): uses XMPP which is standardized
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:31): there isn't any other clients that support the google voice extensions tho, but it's being implemented
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:31): hmh, what abt Jabber?
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:31): XMPP is Jabber
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:31): they have voice and video too
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:32): you mean Jingle?
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:32): Iirc Jingle is the voip component of Google Talk
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:33): nope, i mean, is there any Jabber client with voip?
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:33): not that I know of, aside from Google Talk
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:34): Gaim is working on it
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:34): i know, but i was thinking f in Gossip or in any other OS IM software there were Voip or Video over IP extensions available
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:37): well, jabber voip stuff has been a bit fragmented
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:37): I don't know if there's any other that implement Jingle aside from Google Talk
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:38): but Jingle has a public specification and a library under BSD-style license
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:40): The Google homepage says that Google Talk is available only for Windows
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:43): psi and gaim atleast seem to have jingle support coming up
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:43): or does Casanova have to write it =D
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:43): you can just grab the libjingle stuff and implement it in your favourite client
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:43): gaim developing projects have always been quite long
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:44): should i need to buildmy gaim again wih libjingle?
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:44): I imagine other clients will also implement jingle
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:45): or am i just going to upload it form linuxpackages.org and follow any instructions?
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:45): am full of caffeine, again
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:46): I imagine to get jingle support in gaim, you'd have to grab it from subversion
1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:46): if it's even available there yet
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:47): yeah, so in general, i'd have to associate libjingle with gaim by editing the source code?
9ee227a6a4fb928a191b7e7f37220508 (16:48): but i've never gotten my hands on Gaim or any other Im or Voip aps' code. Well, i've always loved challenge however.

1ed5214d432efe330c170975547201ee (16:50): but you'll have to build it yourself, only i386 packages I see
